trans-unit.source: Allowed and blocked apps for KNOX | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Allowed and blocked apps for KNOX | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Custom profile to create a list of allowed and blocked apps for KNOX.
trans-unit.target: Custom profile to create a list of allowed and blocked apps for KNOX.

trans-unit.source: Use custom policies to allow and block apps for Samsung KNOX devices
trans-unit.target: Use custom policies to allow and block apps for Samsung KNOX devices

trans-unit.source: Use the procedures in this topic to create a Microsoft Intune custom policy that creates one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Use the procedures in this topic to create a Microsoft Intune custom policy that creates one of the following:

trans-unit.source: A list of apps that are blocked from running on the device.
trans-unit.target: A list of apps that are blocked from running on the device.

trans-unit.source: No other apps will be allowed to run.
trans-unit.target: No other apps will be allowed to run.

trans-unit.source: Apps in this list are blocked from being run, even if they were already installed when the policy was applied.
trans-unit.target: Apps in this list are blocked from being run, even if they were already installed when the policy was applied.

trans-unit.source: A list of apps that users of the device are allowed to install from the Google Play store.
trans-unit.target: A list of apps that users of the device are allowed to install from the Google Play store.

trans-unit.source: Only the apps you list can be installed.
trans-unit.target: Only the apps you list can be installed.

trans-unit.source: No other apps can be installed from the store.
trans-unit.target: No other apps can be installed from the store.

trans-unit.source: These settings can only be used by devices that run Samsung KNOX.
trans-unit.target: These settings can only be used by devices that run Samsung KNOX.

trans-unit.source: To create an allowed or blocked app list
trans-unit.target: To create an allowed or blocked app list

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Policy** > **Configuration Policies** > **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com/), choose **Policy** > **Configuration Policies** > **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Create a New Policy** dialog box, expand **Android**, choose **Custom Configuration**, and then choose **Create Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Create a New Policy** dialog box, expand **Android**, choose **Custom Configuration**, and then choose **Create Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name and optional description for the policy and then, in the **OMA-URI Settings** section, choose **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name and optional description for the policy and then, in the **OMA-URI Settings** section, choose **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting** dialog box, specify the following: For a list of apps that are blocked from running on the device:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting** dialog box, specify the following: For a list of apps that are blocked from running on the device:

trans-unit.source: **Setting name.**
trans-unit.target: **Setting name.**

trans-unit.source: Enter **PreventStartPackages**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **PreventStartPackages**.

trans-unit.source: **Setting description.**
trans-unit.target: **Setting description.**

trans-unit.source: Enter an optional description like 'List of apps that are blocked from running.'
trans-unit.target: Enter an optional description like 'List of apps that are blocked from running.'

trans-unit.source: **Data type.**
trans-unit.target: **Data type.**

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, choose **String**.
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, choose **String**.

trans-unit.source: **OMA-URI.**
trans-unit.target: **OMA-URI.**

trans-unit.source: Enter **./Vendor/MSFT/PolicyManager/My/ApplicationManagement/PreventStartPackages**
trans-unit.target: Enter **./Vendor/MSFT/PolicyManager/My/ApplicationManagement/PreventStartPackages**

trans-unit.source: **Value.**
trans-unit.target: **Value.**

trans-unit.source: Enter a list of the app package names you want to allow.
trans-unit.target: Enter a list of the app package names you want to allow.

trans-unit.source: You can use **; : ,** or **|** as a delimiter.
trans-unit.target: You can use **; : ,** or **|** as a delimiter.

trans-unit.source: (Example: package1;package2;)
trans-unit.target: (Example: package1;package2;)

trans-unit.source: For a list of apps that users are allowed to install from the Google Play store while excluding all other apps:
trans-unit.target: For a list of apps that users are allowed to install from the Google Play store while excluding all other apps:

trans-unit.source: **Setting name.**
trans-unit.target: **Setting name.**

trans-unit.source: Enter **AllowInstallPackages**.
trans-unit.target: Enter **AllowInstallPackages**.

trans-unit.source: **Setting description.**
trans-unit.target: **Setting description.**

trans-unit.source: Enter an optional description like 'List of apps that users can install from Google Play.'
trans-unit.target: Enter an optional description like 'List of apps that users can install from Google Play.'

trans-unit.source: **Data type.**
trans-unit.target: **Data type.**

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, choose **String**.
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, choose **String**.

trans-unit.source: **OMA-URI.**
trans-unit.target: **OMA-URI.**

trans-unit.source: Enter **./Vendor/MSFT/PolicyManager/My/ApplicationManagement/AllowInstallPackages**
trans-unit.target: Enter **./Vendor/MSFT/PolicyManager/My/ApplicationManagement/AllowInstallPackages**

trans-unit.source: **Value.**
trans-unit.target: **Value.**

trans-unit.source: Enter a list of the app package names you want to allow.
trans-unit.target: Enter a list of the app package names you want to allow.

trans-unit.source: You can use **; : ,** or **|** as a delimiter.
trans-unit.target: You can use **; : ,** or **|** as a delimiter.

trans-unit.source: (Example: package1;package2;)
trans-unit.target: (Example: package1;package2;)

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**, and then click **Save Policy**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**, and then click **Save Policy**.

trans-unit.source: [TIP] You can find the package ID of an app by browsing to the app on the Google Play store.
trans-unit.target: [TIP] You can find the package ID of an app by browsing to the app on the Google Play store.

trans-unit.source: The package ID is contained in the URL of the app's page.
trans-unit.target: The package ID is contained in the URL of the app's page.

trans-unit.source: For example, the package ID of the Microsoft Word app is **com.microsoft.office.word**.
trans-unit.target: For example, the package ID of the Microsoft Word app is **com.microsoft.office.word**.

trans-unit.source: The next time each targeted device checks in, the app settings will be applied.
trans-unit.target: The next time each targeted device checks in, the app settings will be applied.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the policy
trans-unit.target: Deploy the policy

trans-unit.source: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, then click **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, then click **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box, select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, then click **Add** > **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box, select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, then click **Add** > **OK**.

trans-unit.source: When you select a deployed policy, you can view further information about the deployment in the lower part of the policies list.
trans-unit.target: When you select a deployed policy, you can view further information about the deployment in the lower part of the policies list.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: [Android and Samsung KNOX policy settings in Microsoft Intune](android-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Android and Samsung KNOX policy settings in Microsoft Intune](android-policy-settings-in-microsoft-intune.md)
